aboutMe.title: S M Jahangir
aboutMe.paragraph1: S M Jahangir Hossain stands as a symbol of unwavering dedication to the people of 191, Dhaka-18. Elected as Member of Parliament in the 12 February 2026 National Election, and serving as Joint Convener of Dhaka North BNP, he endured over 329 cases and imprisonment for his political beliefs ‚Äî proving that no sacrifice is too great when fighting for democracy, justice, and the rights of ordinary citizens.
aboutMe.paragraph2: As the elected Member of Parliament for 191, Dhaka-18 constituency, S M Jahangir Hossain is committed to building a humane, just, and welfare-oriented Bangladesh. His dedication extends beyond politics ‚Äî it is a promise to serve the communities of Uttara, Uttarkhan, Dakkhinkhan, Turag, Khilkhet, and Vatara (partial) with integrity, ensuring every voice is heard and every need is addressed.
aboutMe.videoTitle: Let's build a better Dhaka-18 together

hero.name: S M Jahangir
hero.description: Elected Member of Parliament from 191, Dhaka-18 constituency in the 12 February 2026 National Election. A dedicated leader with 35+ years of political experience, 329+ legal cases faced, and imprisonment for democratic ideals.

electionBanner.title: Elected Member of Parliament
electionBanner.subtitle: 12 February 2026 National Election
electionBanner.areas: Uttara, Uttarkhan, Dakshinkhan, Turag, Khilkhet, Airport, Vatara (Partial)
electionBanner.slogan: Serving the People | Developing Dhaka-18 | Building a Better Bangladesh

biography.title: Biography & Life Story
biography.subtitle: A Journey of Dedication, Sacrifice, and Service

earlyLife.title: Early Life & Background
earlyLife.content: S M Jahangir Hossain was born on January 1, 1973, in the village of North Charkumaria, Sakhipur Upazila, Shariatpur District. Growing up in a humble family, he learned the values of hard work, integrity, and service to others from an early age. His father, Late A K M Nuruzzaman, and mother, Late Khayrun Nessa, instilled in him a deep sense of duty towards society and the nation.

education.title: Education & Early Years
education.content: He completed his Secondary School Certificate (SSC) from BG Press School in 1987, followed by Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) from Tejgaon College in 1989. He went on to earn his Bachelor's degree from the same institution in 1991. During his college years, he became deeply involved in student politics, recognizing it as a platform to voice the concerns of the common people.

politicalAwakening.title: Political Awakening
politicalAwakening.content: The political landscape of Bangladesh in the late 1980s shaped young Jahangir's worldview. Witnessing the struggle for democracy and the sacrifices made by political leaders inspired him to join the nationalist movement. In 1990, he formally began his political career as Member Secretary of Tejgaon College Chhatra Dal, marking the beginning of a lifelong commitment to democratic values.

struggle.title: Struggle & Sacrifice
struggle.subtitle: Standing Firm Against All Odds
struggle.intro: The path of a true political leader is never easy. S M Jahangir Hossain's journey has been marked by immense personal sacrifices, legal battles, and unwavering commitment to his principles.

cases.title: 329+ Political Cases
cases.content: Throughout his political career, S M Jahangir Hossain has faced over 329 politically motivated cases. These cases, filed during Awami League regimes, were failure attempts to suppress his voice and deter him from his mission. Yet, he faced each challenge with courage, never backing down from his commitment to democracy and the people of Bangladesh.

imprisonment.title: Years of Imprisonment
imprisonment.content: He has spent years behind bars for his political beliefs and activities. During the 2018-2024 period, like many BNP leaders, he faced severe persecution. Despite the hardships of prison life, he remained steadfast in his resolve, emerging stronger and more determined to serve the people.

persecution.title: Political Persecution
persecution.content: During the Awami League government's tenure, S M Jahangir Hossain faced systematic persecution. His family members were harassed, his business interests were targeted, and attempts were made to break his spirit. But through it all, he stood firm, becoming a symbol of resilience for the people of Dhaka-18.

resilience.title: Unwavering Resilience
resilience.content: What sets S M Jahangir Hossain apart is not just his ability to endure hardship, but his unwavering commitment to peaceful democratic struggle. Even in the darkest times, he never advocated violence or revenge. His message has always been one of unity, democracy, and building a better Bangladesh for all.

vision.title: Vision for Dhaka-18
vision.subtitle: A Promise for a Better Tomorrow
vision.intro: As the elected Member of Parliament for 191, Dhaka-18 constituency since the 12 February 2026 National Election, S M Jahangir Hossain is committed to the comprehensive development and welfare of his constituency.

areas.title: Infrastructure Development
areas.description: Modern roads, improved drainage systems, and enhanced urban planning for Uttara, Turag, and surrounding areas.

areas.title: Education & Youth
areas.description: Quality education for all, vocational training centers, and employment opportunities for the youth of Dhaka-18.

areas.title: Healthcare Access
areas.description: Affordable healthcare facilities, community health centers, and emergency medical services for every resident.

areas.title: Women Empowerment
areas.description: Programs for women's education, entrepreneurship support, and ensuring safety and dignity for all women.

areas.title: Environment & Livability
areas.description: Green spaces, pollution control, and sustainable development to make Dhaka-18 more livable.

areas.title: Justice & Transparency
areas.description: Fighting corruption, ensuring rule of law, and transparent governance for the people.

achievements.title: Achievements & Contributions
achievements.subtitle: A Record of Service and Leadership

items.title: Student Leadership
items.description: Served as Vice President of Student Parliament at Tejgaon College, elected by direct student vote in 1991.

items.title: Youth Mobilization
items.description: Led youth movements as President of Jubo Dal Dhaka North, inspiring thousands of young activists.

items.title: Community Service
items.description: Organized numerous community welfare programs, blood donation camps, and disaster relief efforts.

items.title: Democratic Movement
items.description: Active participant in all major democratic movements, standing for voting rights and fair elections.

items.title: Current Leadership
items.description: Serving as Joint Convener of BNP Dhaka Metropolitan North since 2024, leading the party's activities.

items.title: Elected MP ‚Äì 2026
items.description: Won the 12 February 2026 National Election from 191, Dhaka-18 constituency and became Member of Parliament of Bangladesh.

timeline.details: Member Secretary of Tejgaon College Chhatra Dal
Elected by direct vote of students
President Dhaka Metropolitan North & Central Joint Secretary
Won 191, Dhaka-18 constituency in the 12 February 2026 National Election

quote.text: My fight has never been for personal gain. It has always been for the people of Bangladesh ‚Äî for their rights, their dignity, and their future. Winning the trust of the people of Dhaka-18 in the 2026 election was not just a victory ‚Äî it was a responsibility I carry every day.
quote.author: ‚Äî S M Jahangir Hossain

familyLife.title: Family & Personal Life
familyLife.content: Behind every leader is a family that provides strength and support. S M Jahangir Hossain is a devoted family man. His family has stood by him through all the challenges, providing unwavering support during his imprisonment and political struggles. Currently residing in Uttara, Dhaka, he maintains close ties with his roots in Shariatpur district.

message.title: Message to the People of Dhaka-18
message.content: To my brothers and sisters of Dhaka-18 ‚Äî I have dedicated my life to serving you. I have faced imprisonment, countless cases, and persecution, but I have never wavered. The mandate you gave me in the 12 February 2026 election is a trust I hold sacred. As your elected Member of Parliament, I remain committed to bringing real change to our constituency. Together, we will build better roads, better schools, better hospitals, and a better future for Dhaka-18.

contact.title: Connect with S M Jahangir Hossain
contact.subtitle: Your voice matters. Reach out for support, suggestions, or to join the movement.
